column3:
はい、バザーは今日も行われていますよ
お取引のお手伝いならお任せください
column4:
Yes, the bazaar is being held today as well. 
If you need assistance with your transactions, 
please leave it to me.

column3:
かわいそうに
親を失った子供たちは
今頃どれほど不安な思いをしているか――
column4:
How pitiful it is.
The children who have lost their parents,
How much anxiety must they be feeling right now...

column3:
弟が、空の渦を怖がるので
ずっと家の窓を閉めているんです
まだ幼いながら、大変なことが起こっていると
わかるのでしょうね
column4:
My younger brother is afraid of the vortex,
so I've been keeping the windows of 
our house closed all the time.
Even though he is still young, he must understand
that something terrible is happening, right?

column3:
本当はずっと弟についていたいんです
でも、お店を開かないと
明日、そして明後日に食べる物が――
こうしている瞬間にも、迷うことばかり――
column4:
I want to stay with my younger brother forever.
But if I don't open the shop,
there won't be anything to eat tomorrow, 
and the day after tomorrow--
Even in moments like this, 
I'm constantly filled with doubt--

column3:
さぁさぁ、お疲れでしょう
メガドでお休みならうちへどうぞ！
column4:
Come, come, you must be tired.
If you want to rest at Megado, come to our place!

column3:
覚者さまのためなら
一番いいお部屋を<VAL PRICE_INN>で
ご用意いたしますよ！
寝心地も眺めも最高なんですから！
column4:
For our esteemed Master Arisen,
We will prepare the finest room for you 
at the price of <VAL PRICE_INN>!
Both the comfort and the view 
are simply outstanding!

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
いえいえ、他ならぬ覚者さまですから
無料でご案内いたしますとも！
もちろんお休みになりますよね？
column4:
No, no, since it's none other than Master Arisen,
I'll guide you there for free, of course!
You'll be taking a break, right?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
まぁー、弱化なさっているなんて
お辛いことでしょう
《弱化の治療》は<VAL PRICE_WEAK>ですよ
早速取り掛かってもよろしいでしょうか？
column4:
Oh my, I can't believe you've been weakened.
I'm so sorry you're in pain.
The cure for weakness is <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
May I get right to it?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
あらあら、ここにいらっしゃるまでに
治ってしまわれたみたい――
さすがは覚者さまですね！
column4:
Oh my, it seems you have already been healed 
before coming here. 
Truly, you are a remarkable Arisen!

column3:
うちはメガドでいっちばん古くからある
宿屋なんですよ！
古くて狭そうに見える？
――それが"味"ってものじゃないですか
column4:
Our inn is the oldest one around in Megado!
It looks old and cramped, doesn't it?
—But that's what gives it its charm, right?

column3:
長くやっている宿屋ですから
かつてはお忍びで居住層に遊びにいらした
王族もお泊りになったとか、ならないとか――
column4:
Since we've been in business for a long time,
it's said that royalty used to come and stay here 
incognito to visit the Residential Level.

column3:
戦いに出る方は、宿でついでに
戦技を見直されることも多いんでしょう？
だから、戦技補佐ができる人に
いてもらうことにしたんですよ
column4:
For those who go into battle, it's quite common 
for them to also take the opportunity to reassess 
their combat skills at the inn, right? 
That's why I decided to have someone who can 
provide arts support there as well.

column3:
ええ、ええ
宿は営業していますとも！
どうぞごゆっくりお休みくださいね
column4:
Yes, yes.
The inn is definitely open for business!
Please feel free to rest and relax.

column3:
覚者さまも何かとお疲れでしょう
せっかくアッカーシェランに
来ていただいているのですから
やわらかなベッドくらいご用意しなければね
column4:
Master Arisen, 
you must be tired from your activities. 
Since you have come all the way to Acre Selund, 
we must prepare a soft bed for you.

column3:
オークがメガドに攻め入ってきた時は
これ以上酷いことなんて無いと
思ったものですけどね――
column4:
When the orcs invaded Megado,
I thought there couldn't be anything worse than 
that, but well...

column3:
覚者さま、ぜひ疲れを取ってから
ご出発くださいね
わたしたちには、このくらいしか
できないものですから
column4:
Master Arisen, please rest and recover
before you depart.
We can only do so much for you, after all.

column3:
王子がさ、わたしやメイロワ将軍にも
休みが必要だからって
そんなこと、気にしなくていいのに
column4:
The prince says even I and General Meirova 
need a break.
Don't worry about it, honestly.

column3:
ああ、この水着？
ええと、背の低い――
そう、キャメロンって子が貸してくれたんだ
column4:
Ah, this swimsuit?
Hmm, the short... 
Yes, Cameron lent it to me.

column3:
きれいなデザインだよね
紐や飾りなんかも繊細で――
平和な場所じゃないと、着られない
column4:
It's a beautiful design, isn't it?
Even the strings and decorations are delicate...
You can only wear it in a peaceful place.

column3:
やっぱりレスタニアでは落ち着く？
いつもよりのびのびして見える
――いいね、そういう顔も
column4:
Is it calming in Lestania after all?
You seem more relaxed than usual—
It suits you.

column3:
このサングラス、可愛いでしょー？
キャメロンって子が水着と合わせて
コーディネートしてくれたんだ！
いい子だよね、あの子！
column4:
These sunglasses, aren't they cute?
That girl Cameron coordinated it with a swimsuit!
She's such a good girl, that one!

column3:
海、きれいだねぇ！
魚もいっぱい泳いでたよ
万が一の時には、あたしが捌いてあげるからね！
column4:
The sea is so beautiful!
There were lots of fish swimming around.
If by any chance something happens, 
I'll handle it for you!

column3:
ねぇねぇ、そこら辺に転がってるスイカって――
あっ、やっぱ食べちゃダメだよね！
飾りだよね、アレは
column4:
Hey, hey, those watermelons lying around--
Oh, you shouldn't eat them, right?
It's just for decoration.

column3: やぁ、素敵なビーチへご招待ありがとう
column4: Hey, thanks for inviting us to your lovely beach!

column3:
それが君の"夏の装い"か
なるほど、良いと思うよ
普段とは違った魅力がある
column4:
Is that your "summer attire"?
I see, I think it looks good.
It has a different charm than usual.

column3:
それにしても美しい海だ
透き通っていて、いくら見ていても飽きない
風も柔らかくて気持ちいいしね
column4:
That being said, it is a beautiful sea.
It is so clear, 
and no matter how much you look at it, 
you never get tired.
The breeze is also nice and soft.

column3:
私も、厳密にはもう"ハイセプター"ではないから――
そうだな――もう少し年を取ったら
異国を巡る旅に出るのもいいかもしれない
column4:
I, too, am no longer strictly a "High Scepter" now
--Well, when I get a little older,
It might be nice to embark on a journey 
to foreign lands.

column3:
さっき、君の訓練官に会ったよ
「夏は開放的な気分になるから」と大騒ぎしていたな
――君もそうかい？
column4:
I met your trainer earlier.
They were making a big fuss, 
saying, "Summer feels so liberating."
Are you feeling the same way?

column3:
ここには専属の警備の者たちがいるそうだ
精霊槍の持ち込みも遠慮してくれと
言われてしまった――
column4:
I heard there are exclusive security guards here. 
They even asked me to refrain from 
bringing my Spirit Lance...

column3:
この平穏なる光景、白竜の慈しみによって
維持されているということを忘れるな
column4:
Do not forget that this peaceful scene is 
maintained by the benevolence of the White Dragon.

column3:
――ただ波の音に耳を傾け
無心に己の精神と向き合ってみるのも良いな
どうだ、貴様もそこに座って
少し心を落ち着けていくか
column4:
—Just listen to the sound of the waves,
and try facing your own mind without distraction.
How about it? Sit there too,
and let your heart calm down for a bit.

column3:
わははは！
このビーチではわしのことを知る者なぞ
そう居るまい！
久しぶりに、全力で遊ぶとするかな
column4:
Wahaha! 
On this beach, 
there'll be no one who knows of my existence! 
It's been a while, so I'll play with all my might.

column3:
ここだけの話だがな
――ジリアンに悪い虫が近付かぬよう
こっそり見張っているのだ
column4:
Just between you and me
--I'm quietly keeping an eye out
so no pesky bugs come near Gillian.

column3:
翡翠湖の深い色合いも美しいが
空の色を映したようなここの海もまた美しい
心が洗われるようだ！
column4:
The deep hues of Emerald Lake are beautiful,
But this sea here, 
reflecting the colors of the sky, 
is also beautiful.
It feels as though my heart is being cleansed!

column3:
覚者よ、夏だな！
その恰好を見るに、泳ぐ準備は万端か
column4:
Arisen, it's summer!
And judging by your attire, you're ready for a swim.

column3:
去年のにぎわいを見て
俺も今年は水着を用意したんだ
――たまにはこういった
非日常を楽しむのいいものだな
column4:
Looking at the excitement of last year,
I also prepared a swimsuit for this year.
It's nice to occasionally enjoy
such extraordinary experiences.

column3:
レンテンはあのサングラスが気に入ったようだ
神殿でも、目を離すと付けたり外したりしていた
気分の切替えはしてほしいものだが――
まぁ、大目に見よう
column4:
Renton seems to have taken a liking 
to those sunglasses.
Even in the temple, he would put them on and 
take them off when no one was looking.
It would be nice if he could change his 
mood a bit, though...
Well, I'll let it slide.

column3:
せっかくのビーチだ！
最新の水着にサングラスで
ばっちりキメてきたぜ！
column4:
It's finally the beach! 
I've dressed up perfectly in the 
latest swimsuit and sunglasses!

column3:
さて、一泳ぎしてこようかな
あんたも一緒に行こうよ
これも訓練の一環だって！
column4:
Well, I think I'll go for a swim.
You can come with me too.
It's part of the training!

column3:
え？　仕事？
アーチボルトさんだって来てるんだから
ちょっとくらいいいだろ
まぁ、ちょこちょこ様子は見に戻るからさ
column4:
Huh? Work? 
Even Archibald is here, so it should be 
fine to take a little break, right?
Well, I'll go back and check on things from time to time.

column3:
さぁ、ハロウィン！
仮装とお菓子で盛り上がりましょ！
column4:
Come on, Halloween!
Let's have fun with costumes and sweets!

column3:
今年のお菓子はふんわりパクパク食べられる
プチマフィンと、濃厚な味を楽しめるヌガーよ
どう？　食べたくなってきた？
column4:
This year's snacks are soft and crunchy 
petite muffins and richly flavored nougat.
What do you think?　Are you getting a craving?

column3:
お祭りのために白竜神殿に来るのを
アンジェロも私もとっても楽しみにしてるの！
だから念入りに準備してるんだけど――
column4:
Angelo and I are very much looking forward to 
coming to the White Dragon Temple 
for the festivities!
So we've been preparing for it very carefully...

column3:
お祭りが終わった後でも
お菓子を食べると元気になるのは
きっと楽しい記憶を思い出すからよね
column4:
Even after the festival is over,
eating sweets and becoming energized
must be because it brings back joyful memories.

column3:
だからお祭りっていうのは
目いっぱい楽しくなきゃダメなのよ！
良い「楽しさ」っていうのは
その時だけのものじゃないの
column4:
That's why festivals have to be full of fun!
Good "fun" is not just for the moment!

column3: アノ　オカシ――
column4: That pastry...

column3:
オナカ　ヘタ
ズト　ズト――
column4:
Stomach... Hurts...
Gonna... Gonna...

column3: ミナイデ
column4: Don't look.

column3: ママ　ママ――
column4: Mama, mama--

column3:
見つかっちまったか
この変装は失敗だな
column4:
Spotted.
This disguise is a disaster.

column3:
何じろじろ見てやがる
言っとくが、こりゃあ私服じゃねぇぞ
column4:
Why are you staring at me like that? 
Just so you know, this ain't civilian clothing.

column3:
あ？　何か文句でもあんのか？
商人の服っつったら
やっぱりこれだろうが
column4:
Huh? You got a problem or somethin'? 
When it comes to a merchant's attire, 
this is definitely it, right?

column3:
最初は神官の服を渡されたんだけどよ
あんなもんぜってぇ着るかって
辛気臭え気分になっちまう
column4:
At first they gave me a priest's uniform, 
but I'd never wear such a thing, 
it makes me feel like a psycho.

column3:
ここら辺はまだ神殿の近くだ
見つかるのも無理はねぇな
"祝いの品"も小出しでいいだろ
column4:
This area is still near the temple.
It's not impossible to find something.
"Celebration gifts" can be small.

column3:
ああ！？
お前こんなとこまで
追いかけてきやがったのか！？
column4:
Ah!?
Did you really chase after me
all the way here!?

column3:
気分転換にフンパツして
《豊穣の湯》まで来たってのに――
なんだってお前の顔見ながら
湯に浸からないといけねぇんだか
column4:
I came all the way to the "Abundance Springs" 
for a change of mood, and yet... 
why do I have to soak in the hot water while 
looking at your face?

column3:
リズやらエリオットを
引き連れて来てないだけまだマシか
あいつらがいると、一人頭で
10倍は騒がしくなるからな
column4:
It's still better that I didn't bring 
Lise and Elliot along. 
With them around, 
it would be ten times more chaotic.

column3:
はぁ――
ま、その行動力っつうか
突き進む信念みてぇなのがお前の持ち味だもんな
"祝いの品"受け取れよ、この湯に免じて多めに渡すぜ
column4:
Haah...
Well, I guess your strong sense of determination 
or, shall I say, forward-thinking, 
is your strong suit.
Accept this "congratulatory gift", and I'll give 
you a little extra in honor of this hot spring.

column3:
おいおいおい
こんな場所で、こんな変装までしてるのに
なんで追いかけて来られるんだ！？
column4:
Oi oi oi,
Even in a place like this, and even in disguise,
Why are they able to chase after me?!

column3:
なんだってこう見つかっちまうんだ？
背筋が薄ら寒くなってきやがった
column4:
How the hell did they find us?
I'm getting chills down my spine.

column3:
ま、これからもよろしく頼むわ
お前みたいなやつが味方で良かったぜ
――敵になったら最悪の気分だったろうな
column4:
Well, keep up the good work.
I'm glad to have a guy like you on my side.
--I would have felt terrible if you were my enemy.

column3:
ったく、何が「一番見つかりにくい場所と変装」だ
クラウスのやつ、適当なこと言いやがって
column4:
Jeez, what's with this 
"most inconspicuous hiding spot and disguise"?
That Klaus guy just says whatever he wants.

column3:
実は、ジョゼフともう一つ賭けてたんだよな
ここにいるのを見つけられなきゃ
"祝いの品"の大部分は
俺の物ってことになってたんだが――
column4:
Actually, I had made another bet with Joseph.
If they couldn't find you here,
the majority of the "celebratory gift"
would have become mine--

column3:
しかたねぇ、俺の負けだ！
ああ、負けだ！
ドカッと渡すからありがたく受け取れよ！
column4:
There's no helping it, I've lost!
Ah, it's a defeat!
Here you are, take it all!

column3:
よう、まぁちょっと
話でも聞いていけや
column4: Well, um, why don't you listen to the story for a bit?

column3:
よう、三周年だってな
おめでとうさん
column4:
Hey, it's our third anniversary.
Congratulations!

column3:
で、だ――
突然だけどよ、これから俺はレスタニアの
あちこちに隠れることになった
column4: So, listen up. I suddenly have to hide in various places in Lestania from now on.

column3:
俺を３か所で見つけることができたら
"祝いの品"ってやつをプレゼントっつうわけだ
まぁ気張って探し回ってくれや
column4:
If you can find me in three places,
I'll give you a "celebration gift."
Well, keep your eyes peeled.

column3:
――はぁ？　誰が好きでこんなことするか
ジョゼフのジジイとの
ちょっとした賭けに負けちまって
この役割を押しつけられたのよ
column4:
Huh? Who would willingly do something like this?
I lost a small bet with Joseph's old man 
and got stuck with this role.

column3:
クソッ、勝てたらだいぶと
ウマい内容だったんだがな――
あのジジイ、ほとんど魔物みてぇなもんだ
賭けの誘いになんて乗るんじゃなかったぜ
column4:
Damn, it would have been a lot better if I won.
It was a good one--
The old man was almost like a demon,
I should never have taken that betting offer.

column3:
よしッ！
気合を入れていこう！
column4:
Alright!
Let's get fired up!

column3:
どんな衣装を着ても
新たな魅力を振りまいてくれるのが
そう、シェリーちゃんだ！
小悪魔系から清楚ガールまでただ一人で完全網羅！
column4:
No matter what outfit she wears,
Shelly always radiates a new charm.
Yes, it's Ms. Shelly!
She's the one who can perfectly cover everything, 
from devilish to innocent girl!

column3:
その微笑みで何度でも新鮮な感動をくれる！
むしろ、隣に立っている姿が視界に入るだけで
驚くほど感動してしまう――わかるだろう？
column4:
That smile gives me a fresh sense of wonder 
again and again! 
In fact, 
just the sight of her standing next to you is
amazingly inspiring - you know what I mean?

column3:
シェリーちゃんの今回の衣装、どうかね？
カワイイだろう？　最高だろう？
うむうむ、わかるとも
column4:
What do you think of Ms. Shellys outfit this time? 
Isn't it cute? Isn't it the best? 
Mmm, mmm, I understand.

column3:
実は水色の衣装も用意していたのだが
今回は白でいきたくてね――個人的に
column4:
Actually, 
I had prepared a light blue outfit as well,
but 
this time I wanted to go with white personally.

column3:
今度のプレゼントはすごいぞ
ココだけの話、喜ばれる自信が――ある！
なんといっても"女心"について
これでもかと本を読んで勉強してきたからねッ！
column4:
The present this time is amazing, you know.
Just between us, 
I have confidence that it will be well-received!
After all, I've studied and read books about 
"a woman's heart", extensively!

column3:
ハァイ、バレンタインぶりね
とってもワクワクしてるわ！
column4:
Hi, it's been a while since Valentine's Day.
I'm feeling really excited!

column3:
このスカートのボリューム！
すっきりした上半身とのコンビネーションが
今の気分にジャストなの
コンパクトさがキュートな靴も見てほしいポイントよ
column4:
The volume of this skirt!
The combination with the clean upper body
is just what I'm in the mood for right now.
Also, pay attention to the cute 
compactness of the shoes.

column3:
あのね、アンジェロと一緒にいると
楽しいと感じることや次にやりたいことが
お互いにどんどん湧いてくるの
column4:
You know, when I'm with Angelo, 
I feel so happy and we both constantly come up 
with things we want to do next.

column3:
毎日新鮮で、なのに全然疲れないっていうか
――何ていうか――ううん――ー
アンジェロってとびきり不思議な人なのよ
column4:
Every day, it's fresh, 
and yet I don't get tired at all, or rather, 
how should I put it... 
hmm... 
Angelo is a truly mysterious person.

column3:
ねぇ、今回のアンジェロったら
とってもかっこいいと思わない！？
ロングジャケットの紳士なシルエット――
最高にエスコートされたくなっちゃう
column4:
Hey, don't you think Angelo looks 
really cool this time?
With his gentlemanly silhouette in a long jacket..
I can't help but want to be escorted by him, 
it's the best.

column3: なんだ、やけに楽しそうな顔してるな
column4: You look like you're having a great time.

column3:
ったく、あいつらが神殿に来ると毎回大騒ぎだな
浮かれることしか頭に無いペアってやつか
ま、お似合いなんじゃねぇの
column4:
Geez, every time those guys come to the temple, 
it's always a big fuss. 
They're a pair who only care to have fun, huh? 
Well, I guess they suit each other.

column3:
「誰か一人に一つだけ」ってのも
悪くはねぇんだけどよ
俺はやっぱ数で勝負っつぅのが
わかりやすくて好きだわ
column4:
Having 'one for each person' isn't necessarily a 
bad idea. 
But personally, I prefer competing with numbers. 
It's just more straightforward.

column3:
こりゃまた、騎士団の奴らが
悔しがりそうなメンツだな
column4:
Well, well, this looks like a lineup that would 
make the knights really envious.

column3:
今回は食い物じゃなさそうだな
柔らかい何か――開けてみるとするか
column4:
Doesn't look like food this time.
Something soft-- let's open it up.

column3:
――ソファカバーか！
さてはこの間、俺が
家具職人を呼んだのを見てただろ
column4:
Oh, a sofa cover, huh? 
You must have seen when I called the furniture 
craftsman the other day.

column3:
ったく、粋なことしてくれるじゃねぇか
大きさもちょうど良さそうだ
一瞬、何を持ってきたのかと思ったが
こういうのなら悪かねぇ
column4:
Jeez, you're doing something pretty cool.
The size seems just right too.
For a moment, 
I thought what you brought was something else,
but this is pretty good.

column3:
やたらブワブワした感触なのは――
まぁ、冬だからありっちゃありだな
column4:
The sensation of bubbling is quite strong—
well, I guess it's to be expected in winter.

column3:
今晩家に帰る楽しみができたわ
ありがたくいただいとくぜ！
column4:
Now I have something to look forward to when 
I get home tonight.
I'll take it!

column3:
あっ！　隊長じゃないか
キミもそこに座りなよ
column4:
Ah! It's the captain. 
Why don't you sit there too?

column3:
ちょっとちょっと
メイロワ将軍もいるなんて聞いてないぞ
いや、別にいたからどうってワケでもないけど
column4:
Wait a minute, wait a minute!
I didn't hear that General Meirova would be here too.
Well, I don't mind him being here, but...

column3:
バレたらマズいことが
いくつかあるってだけさ！
column4:
It's just that there are a few things
that would be bad if they were found out!

column3:
いや～、異国にお呼ばれするなんて
軍師やっててよかったよ、ホント！
観光ついでに色々勉強させてもらおうかな
column4:
Being invited to a foreign country like this...
I'm glad I became a strategist, really!
Maybe I should... 
I'm sure I'll learn a lot while I'm sightseeing.

column3:
さっき聞いたんだけど、なんでも
力が湧いてくる温泉があるんだって？
気になるなぁ、ぜひとも行ってみたいなぁ
案内してくれる人がいればなぁ～
column4:
I just heard that there's a hot spring where 
everything comes to life with power?
I'm curious... I'd love to go there.
If only I had someone to show me around!

column3:
ここの酒場ってツマミ以外もあるのかな？
できればシチュー的な物で温まりたいよ
column4:
Does this tavern have anything other than snacks? 
If possible, 
I'd like something like stew to warm up.

column3:
待ちくたびれたよ――
でも、キミが何かくれるはずだと思って
ずっと待ってたんだ
column4:
I've been waiting for ages――
But I've been waiting all this time, 
thinking you'd give me something.

column3:
さぁ、早速だけど見せておくれよ！
その"特別"ってやつを！
column4:
Let's see what you've got!
Let's see what's so "special" about it!

column3: ああ、コレはアレだね！
column4: Oh, this is the thing!

column3:
アレ――テーブルに飾る布！
テーブルセンターっていうんだっけな
ずいぶんオシャレな物をくれるじゃないか！
隊長、ありがとう！
column4:
That thing - a cloth to decorate the table!
I think it's called a table centerpiece!
You've given me something very stylish!
Thank you, Captain!

column3:
知ってるかもしれないけど
ほら、僕の持ち物ときたら
大体どこかへ逃げだすのが得意だからさ
column4:
You might know this already, but my belongings, 
you know, have a knack for running off somewhere.

column3:
これはなくならないように
家にある一番大きなテーブルの
一番広くて良い場所に敷いておかないとだ！
column4:
To ensure that this doesn't disappear,
it must be put on the largest table in the house,
in the widest and best spot!

column3:
ああ、そうそう
これが無くなってしまっていないか
隊長が様子を見にきてくれてもいいんだよ
――ほんとにいつでも、見にきてくれていいから！
column4:
Ah, yes, that's right.
I wonder if it's still here.
It would be nice if the captain could come and 
check on it.
-Really, anytime is fine, so please come and look!

column3: 今年もこの季節が来ましたね！
column4: It's that time of year again!

column3:
こうして、隊長と楽しめる催しに
また呼んでもらえて――光栄です！
column4:
I am honored to be invited back for another event 
that I can enjoy with my captain!

column3:
気になっていることがあるんです
あの二人が、一体どこでアッカーシェランの
人たちを知ったのかって――
column4:
There is something I'm curious about. 
Where exactly did those two learn about the 
people of Acre Selund?

column3:
ジョゼフ様に相談したのか、それとも
実は偵察能力がすごかったりするんでしょうか
――前者は考えにくいですよね
column4:
Did you consult with Mr. Joseph, or
actually have great detective skills?
--The former is unlikely, isn't it?

column3:
酒場の雰囲気、結構好きなんですよ
次の休み、みんなで何か食べに来ませんか
もちろんリズも誘って
column4:
I really like the atmosphere of the tavern. 
How about coming to eat something together on our 
next day off? Of course, let's invite Lise too.

column3:
神殿でゆっくりすることって
最近あんまり無い気がして
column4:
I feel like there hasn't been much time to 
relax at the temple recently.

column3:
あっ、ありがとうございます！！
やったッ！
隊長からのプレゼント、嬉しいです！
column4:
Oh, thank you!
Yay!
I'm so happy to receive this gift from you!

column3:
この色、隊長が選んでくださったんですよね？
すごく素敵です
いえ、もともと好きな色なんですけど！
大好きな色になりました
column4:
Did the captain choose this color for me?
It's really wonderful.
No, it's actually a color I've always liked!
It has become my favorite color.

column3:
あの――これ、俺が隊長の右腕として
直々に認められた証だって
思っていてもいいですか？
column4:
Can I think of this as proof that I have been 
personally recognized as the right hand of the 
captain?

column3:
そうだと思うと、神殿から
どんな勲章をもらうよりも
ずっと誇らしい気持ちに――
何よりも、明日への励みになりますから
column4:
When I think of that, I feel much more proud
than when I receive any medal from the Temple--
because, more than anything else, 
it encourages me for tomorrow!

column3:
――ということで
しばらくは額に入れて飾っておきます！
敷物として使うなんて勿体ないですしね
覚悟ができたらちゃんと使いますよ！
column4:
-- so
I'm going to frame it and display it for a while!
It would be a shame to use it as a rug.
I'll use it properly when I'm ready!

column3:
ああ、覚者
レスタニアの"祭り"だそうだな
にぎわってるじゃないか
column4:
Oh, Arisen,
I hear it's a "festival" in Lestania.
It's a lively place.

column3:
席についていると話しかけられるだろう
俺はここにいるくらいでちょうどいい
column4:
I will probably be approached while seated.
It's just right for me to be here.

column3:
ああ、コレは――レスタニアでなら
顔を隠す必要も無いかと思ったが
何となく落ち着かなくてな
column4:
Ah, in Lestania, I thought there would be no need 
to hide my face, but for some reason, 
I can't seem to calm down.

column3:
相棒、後で一杯飲みに行かないか？
レスタニアの酒の味をみてみたいんだ
静かな店を知ってたら、連れていってくれ
column4:
Hey partner, maybe we can grab a drink later?
I'd like to see what the drinks taste like 
in Lestania.
If you know a quiet place, take me there.

column3:
クク――いや、よく考えたら
お前が俺のところに持ってきたって
驚くようなことじゃなかったな
付き合いの深さは、時間の長さじゃ計れない
column4:
Kukuh... Well, now that I think about it,
it wasn't really surprising that you 
brought me here.
The depth of our connection cannot be 
measured by the length of time.

column3:
この布は――ストールか
ちょうどいい
これからの季節、アッカーシェランでも
夜は冷え込むんだ
column4:
Is this cloth... a stole?
It's just right.
In this season, even in Acre Selund,
the nights get cold.

column3:
家に帰ったら羽織ってみることにしよう
セムやジャンにも見せてやりたい
きっとお前に会いたがるだろうよ
column4:
When I get home, I'll try putting it on and show it to Shem and Jan. 
They would definitely want to see you.

column3:
さて――帰る前に、相棒
一杯飲みに行かないか？
レスタニアの酒の味をみてみたいんだ
静かな店を知ってたら、連れていってくれ
column4:
Now then, before we go back, partner,
how about going for a drink?
I'd like to taste the alcohol in Lestania.
If you know a quiet tavern, please take me there.

column3:
今度メガドに来るときに
隠れた名店を教えてやるから
交換条件といこう
column4:
Next time you come to Megado,
I'll show you some hidden gems.
Let's call it an exchange.

column3: お招きいただき感謝する！
column4: Thank you for inviting me!

column3:
酒場が明るく賑わうのは
良い町の証拠だ！
さすがは白竜様のお膝元といったところだな
column4:
The fact that the bars are bright and bustling is
evidence of a good town!
That's what you'd expect from 
the White Dragon's hometown.

column3:
気分転換になにかしたいと思っていたところだ
そこへ異国の祭りとはうってつけだ！
column4:
I've been looking for something to do for a change
and an exotic festival is just the thing!

column3:
もう少し落ち着いたらば
アッカーシェランでも、何か
みなで楽しめる催しを考えてみるか
column4:
Once things have calmed down a bit,
How about we think of some event
that everyone can enjoy,
even in Acre Selund?

column3:
おおっ！？
本当にわしがもらってもよいものなのか？
――では、ありがたくちょうだいしよう
column4:
Oh?!
Is this really something I can have?
--Well, I'll take it gratefully.

column3:
膝掛けか！
使いやすそうな大きさではないか
それに、触っているとなんとも楽しくなる手触りだ
column4:
A lap blanket!
It's an easy size to use,
and what a fun texture to touch!

column3:
アッカーシェランに帰っても
これに触れれば今日のことを思いだすだろう
column4:
Even when I return to Acre Selund, if I touch 
this, it will surely remind me of today.

column3:
異国の祭りに呼んでいただいただけでなく
おぬしから贈り物までもらえるとは
いや、長生きもしてみるものだな！
column4:
To be invited to a festival in a foreign land
and even receive gifts from you—
Well, long living has its perks!

column3:
ワハハ、いやー楽しい日だ
よし！　せっかく酒場にいるのだ
今日はおぬしも共に飲もうではないか！
朝まで飲み明かすという手もあるぞ！
column4:
Wahaha, what a fun day! Alright then! 
Since we're already in the tavern, 
let's drink together, shall we? 
We could even drink until morning!

column3:
隊長！　こんにちは
ふふ、どうかしましたか？
column4:
Captain! Hello.
Hehe, what's the matter?

column3:
お招きいただき、ありがとうございます
とても嬉しいです
みなさんとの時間を持つことができて――
column4:
Thank you for inviting me.
I'm so glad to have time with you all--

column3:
わたしがここに来られるなんて
白竜さまの導きによるものでしょうか
column4:
I can't believe I'm here.
I wonder if it's because of the 
White Dragon's guidance?

column3:
こうしたお祭りはないけれど
フィンダムの若者も、想いを伝えるために
贈り物をするんですよ
column4:
While we don't have such festivals,
even the Phindym youth give gifts to 
convey their feelings.

column3:
部族によっても違いがありますが
花やアクセサリーを贈る人が多いみたいです
モルフォールでは本も人気だと聞きますね
column4:
It varies from tribe to tribe.
Many people give flowers and accessories.
I hear that books are also popular in Morfaul.

column3:
レスタニアにはまた来てみたいと思ってたんです
それが叶うなんて！
今目の前に広がっている光景――夢のようです
column4:
I had been thinking that I wanted to come 
back to Lestania.
To think that it would actually come true!
The scenery unfolding before my eyes right now... 
it feels like a dream.

column3:
これを、わたしに？
ありがとうございます！
column4:
Is this for me?
Thank you very much!

column3:
きれいな手紙ですね
紙も、文字も凝っていて
特別なものなんだって一目でわかります
column4:
It's a beautiful letter.
Both the paper and the writing are elaborate,
and I can tell at first glance 
that it's something special.

column3:
隊長、わたし――
みなさんと出会って
たくさんのことを知りました
column4:
Captain, with you--
I have learned many things
since meeting everyone.

column3:
今、また新しく知ることができて
本当に幸せなんです
こんなにあたたかな気持ち、いつぶりでしょう
column4:
Now, I am able to learn something new again.
I am truly happy.
How long has it been since I felt such warmth?

column3:
あと少しだけ、ここにいてもいいですか？
隊長と過ごせる時間が楽しくて、夢みたいで――
こんな夢なら、もう少し
見ていたいと思ってしまうんです
column4:
Can I stay here for a little while longer?
I'm enjoying the time I get to spend with the captain, it's like a dream--
If it's a dream like this, 
I'd like to watch it a little longer!

column3:
わたしなら楽しんでるよ
心配しないで
column4:
If it were me, I would be enjoying myself.
Don't worry.

column3:
この酒場はいいね
海と空、両方を眺められる
それに楽しげな人がたくさんいるし
column4:
This tavern is nice.
You can enjoy the view of the sea and the sky.
And there are many cheerful people here.

column3:
この夏、レスタニアの海に招待してもらったけど
神殿に来るのは初めて
column4:
I was invited to the beach in Lestania this summer, 
but this is the first time I've been to the
temple.

column3:
アッカーシェランとは
似ているところも多いけど、やっぱり
違うところもたくさんあるみたいだ
column4:
There are a lot of similarities with Acre Selund, 
but it seems there are still a lot of differences.

column3:
この前、メイロワ将軍が招待されたらしいけど
どんな様子だった？
ううん、ちょっと気になるだけ
column4:
I heard General Meirova was invited the other day.
How did he look?
No, just wondering.

column3:
待って
それ、わたしが受け取ってもいいもの？
"特別な贈り物"だって聞いてたけど
column4:
Wait.
Can I take that?
I heard it's a "special gift," but...

column3:
違う？　わたしのために用意してくれたの？
――それじゃあ、もらっておくよ
ありがとう
column4:
Is that not so?　Did you get it for me?
--I'll take it then.
Thank you.

column3:
変わった紙に、絵みたいな文字
見慣れない様式だけど――きれいな手紙だ
これ、アッカーシェランまで大事に
持って帰りたいな
column4:
On this peculiar paper, 
there are characters that look like drawings.
It's an unfamiliar style, 
but it's a beautiful letter.
I want to take good care of it 
and bring it back to Acre Selund.

column3:
ここのところ、伝令の持ってくる
書類ばっかり見てたから
何だか緊張するよ
column4:
Lately, I've been feeling nervous because I've 
been constantly looking at the documents brought 
by the messengers.

column3:
――あのさ、変なこと聞くけど
こういう贈り物ってどう返事したらいい？
突然慣れないことばっかりで――
column4:
- Um, hey, I know this is a strange question, but
how should I respond to this kind of gift?
Everything is so unfamiliar and sudden...

column3:
えっと――そうだ
今度こっちに来るときにでも
神殿を案内してほしいんだけど
あなたに
column4:
Let's see-- yes,
next time you're here,
I'd like you to show me around the temple.

column3: 隊長！　今回も楽しもうね！
column4: Captain!　Let's have fun again this time!

column3:
戦ってばかりは疲れちゃうから
こういうお祭りがもっとあるといいな
column4:
I'm tired of fighting all the time.
I wish there were more festivals like this.

column3:
ねぇねぇ、シェリーの着てる服
とっても可愛いよね！
今回の服もアンジェロが選んだんだって！
column4:
Hey, hey, what Shelley is wearing
is very cute!
Angelo picked out her outfit this time too!

column3:
それにしても、二人とも白くて豪華な服だし――
何かを連想しちゃわない？
そういうつもりじゃないのかなぁ
column4:
That being said, 
both of them are wearing elegant white clothes...
Doesn't it make you think of something?
I wonder if they didn't intend it that way...

column3:
先月はガルドリンとエリオットが
ここに呼ばれてたでしょ？
羨ましかったんだ～
column4:
Last month, 
Gurdolin and Elliot were called here, right? 
I was so jealous～

column3:
やったぁ！　そうこなくっちゃ！
なになに――？
わぁ、手紙――？
column4:
Yay! I did it! That's how it should be done!
What's this...?
Oh, a letter...?

column3:
うーん
何か良い感じのことが書いてあるのは
わかるんだけど――
言い回しが難しいっていうか――
column4:
Hmm, I can understand that there's something 
written here that has a good feeling to it, but... 
it's hard to put it in the right way...

column3:
あ、でも字が凝ってて素敵だね！
紙も綺麗な色だし、このまま飾っても
良さそうなくらいお洒落だよ
この感じ、わたし好きだな～
column4:
Ah, but the lettering is so intricate and lovely!
The paper has such beautiful colors, 
it's stylish enough to be displayed just as it is.
I really like this feeling～

column3:
なんでだろう
最初はよくわからないと思ったのに
見てるとどんどん嬉しくなっちゃう
column4:
I wonder why...
At first, I didn't really understand,
but the more I look, the happier I become.

column3:
――あ、そっか、隊長からもらったから嬉しいんだ！
この手紙、大切にするね
隊長、ありがと！
column4:
- Ah, I see. 
I'm happy because I received it from the Captain! 
I'll treasure this letter.
Captain, thank you!

column3: うん、何かな？
column4: Yeah, what is it?

column3:
レスタニア、君が護るべき国だね
一度この目で見てみたかった
招待、感謝するよ
column4:
Lestania, the country you're supposed to protect.
I've always wanted to see it with my own eyes.
Thank you for the invitation.

column3:
こうしてたくさんの人と話したり
誰かと共にテーブルにつくのは久しぶりじゃないかな
ここが異国だからか、気分転換にもなるよ
column4:
It's been a while since I've talked to 
so many people, or sat at a table with someone.
Maybe it's because this is a foreign land, 
but it's refreshing.

column3:
火山が無いと、空はここまで透き通って見えるのか
どちらの空が良いというわけではないけど
私はやっぱり、アッカーシェランの
人間なんだなと思って――
column4:
Is it because there are no volcanoes that the sky 
looks so clear here?
I'm not saying that one sky is better 
than the other, but I guess I'm still an 
Acre Selund woman, after all.

column3:
一度受け取ったら
もう返せないけど――
ありがたくいただいてしまおうか
column4:
Once I take it,
I can never return it――
then I'll take it gratefully.

column3:
手紙――
ああ、この紙も普通の物じゃないね
手触りが独特だし、少し変わった香りもする
column4:
Letter--
Yeah, this paper is no ordinary one either.
It has a unique texture and an unusual scent.

column3:
――紙も、言葉も、文字のデザインも
これだけ揃えるのは大変だったろう
column4:
-- the paper, the words, the lettering design...
It must have been hard to get all this together!

column3:
このひとひらの中に
君が私のためにと考えてくれたものが
詰まっているんだね
column4:
Within this petal,
you've packed something
that you've thought of for me, haven't you?

column3:
まいったな
この素晴らしい贈り物への返礼として
渡せるものが、今の私には何もない――
column4:
I'm in trouble.
I have nothing to offer as a return 
for this wonderful gift...

column3:
そうだ――今度、お茶しに来ないかい
最近ようやく、とある焼き菓子を
それらしく作れるようになったんだ
ぜひ君に感想を聞かせてほしい
column4:
That's right―― 
How about coming over for tea next time? 
I've finally managed to make a certain type of 
baked confectionery that looks the part. 
I really want to hear your thoughts on it, 
so please come and try it.

column3: ふふふ、何かしら
column4: Hmmm, what is it?

column3:
舞台にいる彼――
あたくしの住まいに来た瞬間に
ひれ伏さんばかりだったの
よっぽど怖かったのかしら
column4:
He, on stage――
The moment he entered my abode,
He was about to prostrate himself.
I wonder if he was that scared.

column3:
《パッションパピルス》で作った紙のこと？
もちろん知っているわぁ
かなり前に流行した品ね
column4:
You mean the paper made from Passion Papyrus?
Of course I know what it is.
It was all the rage a long time ago.

column3:
したためられた想いを
より強く相手の心に届けると言われているわ
column4:
It is said to make your thoughts and feelings
reach the other person's heart more strongly.

column3:
もっとも、それは魔術を扱える者が作ったもののみ
町の人が興味本位で作った紙に
そんな力は無いから、すぐに廃れてしまったの
column4:
However, only those who can wield magic 
can create such things. 
The paper made by the townspeople out of 
curiosity had no such power, 
so it quickly fell into obscurity.

column3:
まだ少し風が冷たいでしょう
薄着の子たちには、ほんの短い間だけ
暖かい空気をまとえるようにしてあげる
column4:
The wind is still a little chilly, isn't it?
For the lightly dressed children,
let's give them a brief moment
to be wrapped in warm air.

column3:
《パッションパピルス》の手紙――
あたくしにこの手紙を渡すなんて
勇気があるのね？
column4:
Letter from 《Passion Papyrus》 --
You have a lot of courage to give me this letter,
don't you?

column3:
紙や文字はさておいて
――なんてかわいらしい詩なの
嬉しいわ、この詩は
あたくしのためだけに編まれてここにあるのね
column4:
Setting aside paper and words—
what a lovely poem.
I'm delighted; this poem
was crafted solely for me, here.

column3:
まだまだつたないところもあるけれど
手に余る技術を駆使するよりも
素直な感性こそが響くというもの――
ふふ、よくわかっているじゃない
column4:
There may still be some imperfections, 
but it's the genuine emotion that resonates,
more than any overwhelming technique――
Oh, you understand very well.

column3:
でも、もっと上手に歌いたいのなら
あたくしが手ほどきをしてあげてもよくってよ
column4:
But if you want to sing better,
I can teach you.

column3:
美しいさえずりは
その翼をもより良く見せるのですもの
羽ばたきの日まで、楽しませてちょうだい
column4:
A beautiful chirp makes even its wings look better.
Let me enjoy it until the day it takes flight!

column3: こんにちは、ご機嫌いかが？
column4: Hello, how are you?

column3:
こういう日の、特別な空気もだいすき
後で思い出しても楽しい気持ちになるから
column4:
I really love the special atmosphere of days like 
this, because even when I remember it later, 
it brings back delightful feelings.

column3:
今回も、レスタニアとは違う大陸からの
お客さんが来てるんだね！
仲良くなれたらいいなぁ
column4:
Again, I see you have guests from a different 
continent than Lestania!
I hope we can get to know each other.

column3:
お祭りの時だけここに来るあの二人――
旅をしているって言ってたけど
どのくらい遠くまで行ったことがあるのかしら
column4:
Those two who only come here during the festival..
They said they were traveling, 
but I wonder how far they have actually been.

column3:
わぁ、ありがとう！
すてきなお手紙――
column4:
Wow, thank you!
What a wonderful letter--

column3:
このお手紙、いい香りがするね
なんだか懐かしいような、ずっと前から
知ってるような香り
column4:
This letter has a nice scent, doesn't it?
It somehow feels nostalgic, 
as if from a long time ago.
A familiar scent that I seem to know.

column3:
今晩から枕の下にこのお手紙を入れてみようかな
香りで今日のことを思い返して
ワクワクした気持ちで眠れそう
column4:
Shall I put this letter 
under my pillow from tonight?
With its scent, I can reminisce about today
and sleep with an excited feeling.

column3:
あのね、生きていくなかで
わたしが大切にできる物は
きっと限られているのだと思うけど――
column4:
You know, in the midst of living,
I think there are only a few things
that I can truly cherish.

column3:
このお手紙は、ずっと大切にする！
約束するね！
わたしと覚者様が仲良しだっていう証だもの
column4:
I will treasure this letter forever!
I promise!
It's proof that you and I, Ser Arisen, 
are good friends.

column3: 何か言いたいことでもあるのか？
column4: Is there something you want to say?

column3:
さっきマンドラゴラの姿を見た
あれはここで飼われているものか？
フィンダムで見るものとは違う姿をしていたようだが
column4:
I saw the appearance of a Mandragora earlier. 
Is that one of the creatures kept here? 
It seemed to have a different appearance from 
what I usually see in Phindym.

column3:
どうも"シェリーちゃん"なる魔物が
気にかかる
column4: I can't help but be concerned about this "Shelly-chan" monster.

column3:
貴様ほどの者が護る神殿に
そう何度も侵入を試みるとは
俺の想像を超える強力な魔物なのだろう
column4:
For someone like you to repeatedly attempt
to infiltrate the temple I protect,
the creature "Shelly-chan" must be a powerful foe
beyond my imagination.

column3:
白竜とも、精霊竜とも違う竜力を感じる
アッカーシェランの竜か？
それにしては――
column4:
I can feel a dragon power different from both 
the White Dragon and the Spirit Dragon. 
Is this the Dragon Force of Acre Selund? 
But even so...

column3:
毛玉――？
いや、布か
こういった感触の布は珍しい
ほう――こうして首に巻くのか――
column4:
A furball?
No, it's a cloth.
It's rare to find a cloth with this kind of feel.
Oh, so this is how you wrap it around your neck...

column3:
なるほど、これは暖かいな
この寒さになるレスタニアならではの物だろう
column4:
I see, this is warm.
It must be something unique to Lestania, 
where it gets this cold.

column3:
フィンダムに戻れば首を温める必要はない
庵を彩る飾りにはなりそうだが
column4:
There is no need to warm your neck if back in 
Phindym.
It might become a decoration that adorns the 
hermitage.

column3:
ふむ――
レスタニアに来るのはこれで何度目かになる
だが、貴様とこの地を歩いたことは無かったな
column4:
Hmm...
This must be my umpteenth time coming to Lestania.
But I have never walked this land with you.

column3:
この祭りが終わったら
神殿の外を少し見て回ろうと思っている
時間があれば、共に来るがいい
column4:
After this festival,
I'm going to take a little look around 
outside the temple.
If you have time, come along.

column3:
――レスタニアの魔物との戦いに
興味が湧いただけだ
ついでに、長稽古を付けてやる
腕がなまっていないかの確認としてな
column4:
I was just interested in fighting the monsters 
of Lestania. 
As a bonus, I'll give you some intense training 
to make sure your skills haven't gotten rusty.

column3:
ま、貰いっぱなしってのも
なんだからな
column4:
Well, I can't just keep taking 
without giving anything in return.

column3:
エリオットのやつが妙に
はりきっちまってよ
あいつ、意外と行動力あるみたいだぜ
column4:
Elliot seems unusually energetic lately.
Surprisingly, he's quite proactive.

column3:
ここに立つのも慣れたってわけじゃねぇが――
いや、慣れたのか、これは
column4:
Standing here doesn't mean I'm used to it—
No, perhaps I have gotten used to it.

column3:
こういうイベントごとってのも
刺激ではあるな
そう考えると、悪くはねぇ
column4:
Events like this can be quite stimulating. 
When I think about it, it's not a bad thing.

column3:
やたらとお前から欲しがってるやつらが
並んでるってのに、俺に渡していいのか？
――ま、ありがたく受け取っとくぜ
column4:
There are so many people lining up to ask for this 
from you, are you sure you want to give it to me?
――Well, I'll gratefully accept it, then.

column3:
もし、誰がお前から貰えるかって
賭けがあったら、俺は大穴だったろうな
column4:
If there was a bet on who could receive something 
from you, I would have been a long shot.

column3:
なんだ、思わせぶりだな
――別に欲しいわけじゃねえけどよ
column4:
What, teasing me, huh?
—It's not like I want it or anything.

column3:
あ？　お前、さっき別のやつに
渡してなかったか？
よくわからんが、一人にしか
渡せないルールなんだってよ
column4:
Huh? Did you not give it to someone else earlier? 
I don't really understand, but apparently there's 
a rule that it can only be given to one person.

column3:
ありがたく受け取っとくぜ
また作った時は俺んとこに持って来いよ
旅の最中に軽くつまむのに良さそうだからな
column4:
I'll take that as a thank you.
If you make it again, bring it to me.
Looks like a good way to grab 
a quick bite while traveling.

column3:
せっかくのお祭りです
楽しみましょう、隊長！
column4:
It's a festival.
Let's have fun, Captain!

column3:
俺たちからのお返し――
かなり悩んだんですけど、きっと隊長に
喜んでもらえるものになったはずです
column4:
Our return gift to you, Captain...
I really struggled with it, but I'm sure it has 
become something that will make you happy.

column3:
リズとメイリーフからのお返しは
何でしたか？
聞いてみたけど、教えてくれなかったんです
column4:
What was the return gift from Lise and Mayleaf?
I asked, but they didn't tell me.

column3:
チョコレートをたくさんの人から貰うと
お返しも大変になりますね
あ、でも、隊長へのお返しは特別ですよ！
column4:
When you get chocolates from so many people,
it can be hard to give back.
Oh, but giving back to the captain is special!

column3:
俺にくれるんですか？
ですよね！　嬉しいです！
column4:
You're giving it to me?
Yes, right?　I'm so glad!

column3:
これは隊長からの信頼が形になったものだと思うと
すぐに食べるのは勿体ないような――
少し飾ってから食べちゃダメですか？
column4:
Thinking that this is something that represents 
the trust from the Captain,
it feels like a waste to eat it right away--
Is it not allowed to decorate it a little first?

column3: 待ってる間、変に緊張してしまいました――
column4: I got strangely nervous while waiting--

column3:
次は俺にくれるって信じて待ってました！
――え、最初に渡した人にしか渡せないルールが！？
そ、そんな――
column4:
I've been waiting, 
believing that you would give it to me next!
- Eh, there's a rule that it can only be given to 
the person it was originally handed to!?
Th-That's...

column3:
隊長、ありがとうございます！
信頼の証をこんなに――
じわじわと嬉しさが増していくようで
もう、何個でも欲しくなります
column4:
Thank you so much, Captain!
So much proof of trust--
I'm slowly getting happier and happier,
I want more and more of them already!

column3: やぁ、今日もにぎわってるね
column4: Hey, it's busy today!

column3:
まさか、またこのステージに
立つなんて――
まぁ、慣れたもんだよ
column4:
I never thought I would stand on 
this stage again...
Well, I guess I've gotten used to it.

column3:
決まった日に贈り物をもらって、それにお返しを
するっていうのも不思議なお祭りだよね
要するに、親密さを確かめ合ってるのかな
column4:
Receiving gifts on a designated day and then 
returning them, it's such a strange festival, 
isn't it? 
In other words, 
it's like confirming our intimacy with each other.

column3:
そういえば、前回のお祭りの時に
ジョゼフ様にチョコレートをあげてみたんだ
喜んでもらえたのは確かだと思うんだけど
なぜか未だに食べずに置いてあるんだよね
column4:
By the way, 
I remember that during the last festival, 
I tried giving Master Joseph some chocolate. 
I'm pretty sure he was happy about it, 
but for some reason, 
he still hasn't eaten it, it's just sitting there.

column3:
へぇ、いい香りだ――
それにすごく甘くておいしい！
確かに、これは珍しくて良いモノだね
ありがとう！
column4:
Wow, it smells so good...
And it's incredibly sweet and delicious!
Indeed, this is something rare and wonderful.
Thank you!

column3: どうしたんだい、ゴソゴソして
column4: What's wrong? Why are you fidgeting?

column3:
一度誰かにあげたら、他の人には
あげられないっていうルールらしいよ
――何か理由があるのかな
column4:
I heard the rule is that once you give it to 
someone, you can't give it to anyone else.
--I wonder if there's a reason for that.

column3:
またくれるのかい、ありがとう！
甘いものは結構好きなんだ
考え事をしている時や本を読む合間に食べると
いい気分転換になるからね
column4:
Are you giving it to me again? Thank you! 
I actually quite like sweet things. 
When I'm thinking or in between reading books, 
eating them helps me feel refreshed.

column3:
ふふ、またみんなで集まれて
嬉しいな
column4:
Hehe, 
it's nice to be able to gather together 
with everyone again. I'm glad.

column3:
お返し、リズと一緒に準備したの
何がいいかなって考えるの、とっても
楽しかったよ
column4:
The return gift, I prepared it together with Lise.
I had a lot of fun thinking up what would be good.

column3:
やっぱり、みんながニコニコしてると
幸せな気持ちになって
わたしもニコニコしちゃう
column4:
After all, when everyone is smiling,
I can't help but feel happy too,
and I start smiling as well.

column3:
この前のお祭りの時、わたしも
パメラと一緒にチョコを作ったの
ちゃんと上手にできたんだよ
column4:
At the last festival, I also made chocolates with 
Pamela and we were really good at it!

column3:
わたしがもらっていいの？
――ん、滑らかで濃厚！
すごい、こんなお菓子は初めて！
ありがとう、とっても美味しいよ
column4:
Can I have some? 
Hmm, it's smooth and rich! 
Wow, I've never had a snack like this before! 
Thank you, it's really delicious!

column3: どうしたの？　何か探し物？
column4: What's wrong? Are you looking for something?

column3:
《特製チョコレート》は誰か一人にしか
あげられないんだって
――八方美人はよくないからって
シェリーが言ってたよ
column4:
I heard that the "Special Chocolate" can only 
be given to one person.
—Sherry said that being two-faced isn't good.

column3:
わぁ、嬉しい！
ほんとはもっと欲しいなって思ってたの
美味しくて、さっきのはすぐ食べちゃった
column4:
Wow, I'm so happy!
I was really hoping to get more.
They were so good, 
I ate the ones I had earlier right away!

column3: 隊長、目いっぱい楽しんでる！？
column4: Captain, are you enjoying yourself to the fullest?

column3:
メイリーフと二人でお返しの準備したんだ
隊長のために一生懸命考えたからね！
column4:
Mayleaf and I prepared the return gift together.
We thought very hard for the captain, you know!

column3:
もしもこの前、隊長がここに立ってたら
きっと今頃レスタニア中の人に
"お返し"することになってたよね！
column4:
If the captain had been standing here the other 
day, I'm sure they would be "giving back" to 
all of Lestania by now!

column3:
二人一組でお返しを用意したんだけど
クラウスが一人になっちゃったんだよね
本人は気にしてないみたいだったけど――
ちゃんと用意できたか心配だよ
column4:
We prepared the return gifts in pairs, 
but Klaus ended up being alone. 
He doesn't seem to mind, 
but I'm worried if we were able to 
prepare them properly.

column3:
やった！　さすが隊長、見る目あるよね！
それじゃ、いただきまーす
――わ、美味しい！　とろける！
隊長はコレ、もう食べた？
column4:
Yes! Well done, Captain! 
You really have a good eye! 
Alright then, let's dig in. 
-Oh, this is delicious! It's melting in my mouth! 
Captain, have you already tried this?

column3: えー、何か貰えると思ったのにな～
column4: Oh, I thought I would receive something...

column3:
あ、隊長！
お祭りのルールで、八方美人はダメなんだって
うう――わたしとしては欲しいんだけど――
column4:
Ah, Captain!
According to the festival rules, you can't have it all ways.
Ugh--I'd love to have it--but...

column3:
ラッキー！　じゃなくて、ありがとう！
もっと食べたいと思ってたところだったんだ
隊長から貰ったものだと思うと
美味しさがさらに増すよ
column4:
Lucky! No, thank you! 
I was just thinking that I wanted to eat more. 
When I think that it's something I received from 
the captain, the deliciousness increases!

column3: 夏、楽しんでるかい？
column4: Are you enjoying your summer?

column3:
えっ、夏だっていうのにビーチに
行かない手があるっていうのか？！
――ありえない！
山は秋に行けばいいさ
column4:
What?! 
Are you saying that there's no way we can go to 
the beach even though it's summer?! 
That's impossible! 
We can go to the mountains in autumn.

column3:
ビーチで何をするのかって？
肌を焼いたり、水辺で遊んだり
陽の光を浴びながら友と語らったり
海の幸を楽しんだり――挙げきれないな！
column4:
What do you do at the beach?
Well, you can sunbathe, play in the water,
have conversations with friends while basking in 
the sunlight, enjoy the bounty of the sea... 
the list goes on!

column3:
ああ、水着を着ていても
水に触れるのは浅瀬だけにしておいた方がいい
この時期、ヒュージブルだけじゃなく
サメもいるから、さ
column4:
Ah, even if you're wearing a swimsuit, it's 
better to only touch the water in the shallows.
During this season, there are not only the Brine,
but also sharks, so...

column3:
どーお？
夏、輝いてるぅ？
column4:
What's up?
Summer's shining, huh?

column3:
夏のギラギラした太陽って素敵でしょ？
私たちもそれに負けないように
ビカビカに輝かなくっちゃね～
column4:
Isn't the scorching summer sun wonderful?
We must also burn brightly,
so we won't be outshone～

column3:
夏は一年のうちで今だけ！
そして、今年の夏は人生で一度きり
輝かないで終われる？
column4:
Summer is only once in the year!
And this summer is only once in a lifetime.
Will you let it end without shining?

column3:
いい感じの水着はすぐに試すことにしてるの
コレ、なかなかでしょぉ？
column4:
I've made it a habit to try on nice 
swimsuits right away.
This one, isn't it quite nice?

column3:
ここで話すのか？
いつ巨人が来るかわからない
手短に頼むよ
column4:
Are we going to talk here?
I don't know when the Giants will come.
Please keep it brief.

column3:
レスタニア区ローテス？
全く聞いたこともない地名だ
column4:
Lestanian District Rotes?
I've never heard of that place at all.

column3:
ここ、妙な臭いがしないか？
肌も少しべたべたするし――
空気に何か含まれてる気がするんだが
column4:
Do you smell something strange here?
My skin feels a bit sticky...
I feel like there's something in the air.

column3: 早く本隊に合流しないと――
column4: If we don't join up with the main group soon--

column3:
今回の催しは、遠方からも客人を招いているそうだ
万が一のことがあってはならん
いつでも動けるよう備えておかねばな
column4:
It seems that this event has invited guests 
from afar.
We must be prepared in case anything 
unexpected happens.

column3:
いつもと違う雰囲気に呑まれ
沖まで出ようとする者が出るやもしれん
事故が無いよう、見張っているのだ
column4:
The unusual atmosphere may cause some of them 
to try to go out to sea.
We are on the lookout for accidents.

column3:
この辺りの海岸は遠浅になっている
柵があるところまではヒュージブルも出ないが――
そら、沖を見てみろ
column4:
The coastline around here becomes shallow. 
Until you reach the area with fences, 
there won't be any Brine, but... 
Look, try looking out to sea.

column3:
柵を越えると
ヒュージブルだけでなく鮫もうろついている
貴殿も沖へは出ないことだ
column4:
When crossing the fence, 
it's not only the Brine but also lurking sharks.
It is advised that you do not venture out to sea.

column3:
しかし暑いな
おまけに日中は照り返しもある
――あとで一泳ぎしてくるとしよう
column4:
But it's hot and the sun is shining.
--I'll go for a swim later!

column3:
言うな――
ゲルト騎士団長の水着のセンスが
少し若々しいことくらい、何だというのだ
column4:
Don't say that--
What's wrong with Commander Gerd's slightly 
youthful sense of style when 
it comes to swimsuits?

column3:
あまりハメを外し過ぎないでくれ
柵や門の向こうは会場外だ
column4:
Please don't go too wild and let loose too much.
Beyond the fence and gate is outside the venue.

column3:
規則は規則だからな
越えようとするなら、例えあんたでも
引っ張り戻さないといけなくなる
column4:
Rules are rules,
and if you try to cross them, even if it's you,
I'll have to pull you back.

column3:
突然このビーチへの招待状が届いたんだ
――興味は無かったが、部下たちに
どうしても息抜きすべきだと主張されてな
column4:
I got an invitation to this beach out of the blue.
-- I wasn't interested, but my guys insisted
that I should really take a break.

column3:
ここには魔物も、ましてやオークもいない
一時的なものだが絵に描いたような平和だな
column4:
There are no demons here, much less orcs.
It's temporary, but it's picture-perfect peace.

column3:
だが、戦うわたしたちの
背後に何があるか、誰がいるか――
そんなものを再認識させてくれる
column4:
But it reminds us of what lies behind us, 
of who stands with us, as we fight.

column3:
わたしがここにいるのが珍しいか？
――まぁ、適当にすごして
すぐに戻るつもりだ
column4:
Is it unusual for me to be here?
--Well, I'll just hang out and get back soon.

column3:
ここはわたしの居場所ではない――
おまえも、本当はそう思っているのではないか？
column4:
This is no place for me--
You really think so too, don't you?

column3:
ふふ、その顔を見ればわかる
――また最前線で会おう
column4:
Hehe, just by looking at that face, I can tell
―― Let's meet again on the front lines.

column3:
俺も《黄金ヤシの繊維》を集めて
取引きに使おうかとも思ったが――
column4:
I thought about collecting some 
"Golden Palm Fibers" too
and using them to make a deal, but--

column3:
やめたよ
今日は休業だ
ひたすらのんびり過ごしてやろうと思ってね
column4:
I quit.
Today is a day off.
I plan to spend it leisurely.

column3:
せっかくのビーチだ
ポーンにも水着を選んでやるといい
column4:
It's a rare opportunity to be at the beach. 
It would be nice to choose a swimsuit for 
the Pawns as well.

column3:
――よかったら、コーネリアにも
会っていってくれ
なかなか良い色の水着が手に入ったんだ
column4:
—If you'd like, please go meet Cornelia too.
I managed to get a really nice-colored swimsuit.

column3:
ほらな
覚者になったって、楽しもうと思えば
いくらでも楽しめるんだ
column4:
You see, even if you're an Arisen, 
you can have as much fun as you want, 
if you want to.

column3:
リズ様、食べきれないほど大きなスイカで
スイカ割りをしたいとおっしゃっていて――
column4:
Lady Lise has expressed her desire to play 
watermelon splitting with a watermelon that is 
so big she can't finish eating it.

column3:
リズ様はやりたいことがたくさんおありのようで――
さっきからあちこちに目移りしていらっしゃるのです
column4:
It seems that Lady Lise 
has many things she wants to do--
she has been looking around restlessly 
since earlier.

column3:
リズ様も私も、海辺でこのように過ごすのは
初めてのことなのです
column4:
Both Lady Lise and I have never spent time like 
this by the seaside before.

column3:
夏ですね、覚者さま！
こんな風にビーチで遊べるなんて
思ってもみませんでした！
column4:
It's summer, Master Arisen!
I never imagined we could have this much fun 
playing on the beach like this!

column3:
水着を持っている人たちは
みなさんビーチに来られているみたいですよ
column4:
It seems that everyone who has swimsuits
has come to the beach.

column3:
え？　本日のニュースですか？
――えっと、今日は――
とっても良いお天気、素敵な夏です！
column4:
Huh? Is it today's news?
Um, well, today is... 
such beautiful weather, a lovely summer!

column3:
覚者よ、あなたも"サマーバケーション"か？
ファビオ様は
「サマーバケーションをエンジョイ」だそうだ
column4:
Arisen, are you going on a "Summer Vacation" too? 
It seems that Master Fabio says to 
"Enjoy the Summer Vacation."

column3:
この小さな服はファビオ様の
見立てによるものだ
ビーチへ行くことが
決まった時、突然手渡された
column4:
This little outfit was fashioned by Lord Fabio.
When it was decided we were going to the beach,
it was suddenly handed to me.

column3:
そして、こう言われた
「今回は髪を際立たせる色と
　繊細なレースがこだわりだ」と
column4:
And they told me this:
"This time, the colors that highlight the hair and
the delicate lace are the focus."

column3:
柵の外はビーチフェスティバルの会場ではない
出ようとする者へは声掛けをするようにと
言いつけられている
column4:
Outside the fence is not part of the venue 
for the Beach Festival.
We have been instructed to call out to 
anyone trying to leave.

column3:
わっ！？　な、なんだ、お前か――
こんなところで何してるんだ！
column4: Oh! W-Whoa, it's you... What are you doing here?!

column3:
俺か？　俺は――
ちょっと眩しくて、日陰に――
column4:
Me?　I'm--
It's a little too bright, and I'm in the shade, so--

column3:
うわっ！　お前、いたのか！
――お前、うかつに副隊長に近づこうと思うなよ
あの美しさで焼き焦がされるぞ
column4:
Whoa! You're here!
-- Don't you dare approach the Vice Captain so 
carelessly.
You'll be charred by her beauty.

column3:
海辺のヴァネッサ副隊長――
鮮烈に輝く太陽の女神のような美しさだ
column4:
Vanessa, the Vice Captain of the Beach――
She possesses a beauty that shines brilliantly, 
like the goddess of the sun.

column3:
ビーチの方でグレゴリーさんが
鑑定交換のお店を出してますよ！
どうも、海自体には興味がないみたいです
column4:
Mr. Gregory has set up an Appraisal Exchange shop over 
by the beach! 
It seems like he isn't interested in the sea 
itself, though.

column3:
セネカさんと遊びに来たんですけど
覚者さまたちを見ていたら
何かとご案内したい気持ちに――！
column4:
I came to play with Seneka,
but as I watched the Arisen,
I felt a strong desire to guide them in some way...!

column3:
あ、お手洗いなら
砂浜の奥の方にもありますよ
column4:
Ah, if you're looking for a restroom,
there's one further back on the beach.

column3:
ビーチを楽しむ装いは見つかりましたか？
水着としても使える装備を取り揃えてみました
どうぞ、見ていってくださいね！
column4:
Have you found an outfit to enjoy the beach?
We have a selection of equipment that can also 
be used as swimwear.
Please take a look!

column3:
照りつける日差し、透き通る海
それでは！　この夏を讃える一曲を――！
column4:
The sun shining, the sea crystal clear.
Let's see!　A song to celebrate this summer...!

column3:
るらら～
この歌は、真夏に輝く覚者さまのために～
column4:
Lalala～
This song is for the Arisen who shines in the midst of summer～

column3:
さて、本日も盛り上がってまいりました～
しかしまだまだ終わりません、さらに一曲――
column4:
Now, 
we have once again reached a high point today～
But, it's not over yet. One more song to go――

column3:
ふぅ、開けた空間で風を浴びるのも
気持ちがいいものね
column4: Whew, it feels good to be in an open space with a breeze.

column3:
あらぁ、日焼けを心配してくれるの？
いいのよ――魔術で焼けるのを防いでいるから
初歩的なことよ、ふふふ
column4:
Oh, worried about my sunburn, are you?
It's fine―― I'm preventing it with magic.
Just a basic thing, hehehe.

column3:
海と魔術も無関係じゃないのよ
潮力――その大きな力の法則を知ることは
世界そのものを覗き込む一歩に繋がるわ
column4:
The sea and magic are not unrelated.
Tidal power--knowing the laws of that great force 
is one step toward looking into the world itself.

column3:
ふふ――こんなところまで来て
お勉強も無粋かしら？
いいわ、遊んでいらっしゃい
column4:
Hehe... To think you've come all the way here.
Is studying too dull for you?
Very well, then. Enjoy yourself.

column3:
ビーチに招待してくれてありがとう
――あれ？
あの招待状、君からじゃなかったの？
column4:
Thank you for inviting me to the beach.
- Wait, huh?
That invitation, it wasn't from you?

column3:
波の音が心地いいね
研究の息抜きにちょうどいいわ
column4:
The sound of the waves is soothing.
Just the thing to take a break from research.

column3:
本当言うとね、来ようかどうしようか
ちょっと迷ってたの
column4:
To tell you the truth, 
I wasn't sure if I should come or not.

column3:
でも、来てよかったわ
こうして外の景色に触れることで視点を変えられる
帰ったら、何か新しい発見をできそう
column4:
But, I'm glad I came. 
By experiencing the view outside, 
I can change my perspective. 
When I return, 
it seems like I'll be able to make 
some new discoveries.

column3:
あんたも見てみろって！
高いとこから眺める海も最高だぜ！
column4:
Why don't you take a look too!
The view of the sea from up high is the best!

column3:
いや～、一番でっかい白竜像あるだろ？
あれに登りたかったんだけどさ
さすがに壊すとマズいから自重したってワケ
column4:
Oh, the biggest White Dragon Statue, right? 
I wanted to climb on it, but well, I restrained 
myself since it would be bad to break it.

column3:
修理が大変そうってのもあるけど
神殿の怖い人らがすっ飛んできそうだろ？
column4:
I know it's a lot of work to fix it, but the 
scary people in the temple are going to come 
flying out of the woodwork, right?

column3:
夏の岩山もいいけど、海もなかなかだな
果てしなく海と空が続いてる景色
"自由"を感じるよ
column4:
The summer rocky mountains are nice, 
but the sea is also quite beautiful. 
The scenery where the endless sea and sky 
continue is a sight that makes me feel "free".

column3: きゃっ！　平べったい魚！
column4: Kya!　Flat fish!

column3: メイリーフちゃん、そこにちっちゃな魚が！
column4: Mayleaf, there's a little fish there!

column3:
波がずっと続くの、面白くって！
お姉様、水に入るのも楽しいですよ！
column4:
The waves go on forever, it's fun!
Sis, it's fun to get in the water too!

column3:
あっ、覚者様
――こほん、ちょっとはしゃぎすぎたかしら
column4:
Ah, Ser Arisen.
Ahem, perhaps I got a bit too carried away.

column3:
美しい光景ですね――
わたしたち、海へはあまり行かないものですから
ディリスもすっかりはしゃいでいますわ
column4:
It's a beautiful sight--
We don't go to the beach very often.
Dirith is totally excited too!

column3:
ふふふ、覚者様もここで海の風を
楽しんでいかれませんか？
column4:
Hehe, would you, Ser Arisen, 
like to enjoy the sea breeze here as well?

column3:
ディリス、メイリーフさん
あまり深くへはいかないようにね
column4:
Dirith, Ms. Mayleaf.
Please be careful not to go too deep.

column3:
此度の招待に礼を言わねば――
ここの族長はどなたなのだろうか
column4:
I must express my gratitude for this invitation—
I wonder who the chief of this clan is.

column3:
美しいところだ
白竜の加護に、わたしも感謝しよう
column4:
It's a beautiful place.
I too will thank the 
White Dragon for his blessings!

column3:
レスタニアとは自由な国なのだな
この歳になって、目に映る全てが
新鮮に感じることなどそう無い――
column4:
Lestania is indeed a country of freedom.
At my age, it's not every day that everything I 
see feels so fresh--
and it's not often that I feel that way.
